basics.name: Noah Silverman
basics.label: Mechanical Engineer
basics.summary: Mechanical Engineer and M.S. candidate at Brown University (’26) with experience in design for manufacturing and FEA/FEM analysis. Skilled in prototyping and testing complex systems, and effectively collaborating across disciplines in fast-paced, hands-on environments.

activities: Graduate TA – Vibrations of Mechanical Systems
Undergraduate TA Energy and the Environment
awards: Sigma Xi - Scientific Research Honor Society, Inducted 2025

Robotics.name: Brown ACT Lab
highlights: Prototyping a lightweight, robust system to facilitate mid-air drone assembly and integrating cascading PID, SMC, and MPC robotics control strategies for Automatic Coordination of Teams (ACT) Lab.
Analyzed weight and strength of frame materials (13% under max weight); designed reliable assembly/disassembly method.

Robotics.name: Athletek
highlights: Developing 25 durable components to improve prototype stability and maneuverability for early stage robotics startup.
Selecting motors from calculated torque and system requirements, accounting for electrical power availability.
Compiling a Bill of Materials (BOM) and sourcing components from vendors or manufacturing in house.

Robotics.name: Vibrations of Mechanical Systems & Wilhelmus Lab
highlights: Designed an electromechanical shrimp leg to study locomotion dynamics in collaboration with 5 members.
Owned design and development of prototype leg, fin, and solenoid covers to integrate electronic and dynamic systems.
Implemented PID, and validated voice coil style actuation for compact, waterproof propulsion.

Industry.name: Vatn Systems [AUV]
highlights: Redesigned 11 shell and mounting components in bow module to improve packaging, ballast speed and accuracy, and facilitate mission-critical payload integration for autonomous underwater vehicles in a fast-paced, startup environment.
Improved impact resilience and hydrodynamic profile of masts housing navigation antennas.
Gained hands-on experience prototyping 16 compliant resin masts with embedded electronics using injection molding and SLA/FDM 3D printed shells; integrated and assembled complex hardware on vessel.
Documented mast specifications, performance, and manufacturing process outcomes; outlined steps for effective production.
Identified 14% decrease in drag coefficient from CFD data; informed management decision on design tradeoffs for MVP.

Industry.name: ACS Industries, Inc.
highlights: Created 9 detailed CAD parts to adapt a 50 component wire mesh manufacturing machine to accommodate larger products.
Ran Instron non-destructive deflection tests to validate 300+ production exhaust components.

Industry.name: VoltServer
highlights: Wired and assembled three 5 level electronics test fixtures for contract manufacturers to test custom power distribution units.
Updated wiring and mechanical drawing documentation; designed and 3D printed enclosures for safe use of load resistors.

Projects.name: Brown Formula Racing
highlights: Lead a team of 8 students in iterative design of an aerodynamics package of 100 components
Conducted critical design reviews and collaborated with cross-disciplinary teams to derive product requirements.
Increased downforce by 22.7% by parametrically optimizing 80+ geometry variables using 2D and 3D CFD.
Developed lift and drag validation test plans using wind tunnel and race data; quantified improvements in car performance.
Managed composites testing, including mold design, CNC, vacuum bagging, and post-processing of 15 aero parts.

Projects.name: Brown Formula Racing
highlights: Owned end-to-end drivetrain design, analysis, and testing for 2024 racecar.
Developed CAD and CAE models and mechanical drawings for 75+ drivetrain components; held DFM reviews.
CAM, CNC, and manual machined 15 custom components; rebuilt and tuned differential to 40º/50º ramp angles.
Optimized final drive ratio from fundamental calculations, and integrated with suspension to maximize torque output.
Achieved 30.1% mounting mass reduction with 1.4 FOS in FEA under maximum load.

Projects.name: Brown Formula Racing
highlights: Owned end-to-end design and implementation of a reliable, dual-pass radiator for 2023 racecar, resolving 5 years of overheating issues.
Analyzed dynamometer temperature and flowrate data for appropriate radiator sizing using heat transfer fundamentals.
Conducted fan flowrate and electric current testing to determine fan spec and mounting position.
Compiled a Bill of Materials (BOM) and sourced custom components from vendors based on engineering drawings.

Projects.name: High Reynolds Number Flows
highlights: Compared 10+ airfoil profiles using low fidelity aerodynamics tool XFLR5 to select highest efficiency airfoils.
Tested three iterations of airfoils in a wind tunnel, using strain gauges to measure tangential and normal forces across AoA.
Converted test forces to lift and drag data and compared to theory, refining accuracy with finite airfoil outwash corrections.

Projects.name: Structural Analysis
highlights: Simulated the nonlinear dynamic response of a hockey stick during a slapshot, approximating material properties of a carbon fiber stick and dynamics by modeling contact and time-dependent loading.
Studied the effect of stick stiffness on blade velocity, and validated findings against literature data.
